\ecvsection{Teaching and Course Coordination}
\begin{lyxlist}{00.00.0000}
\item [{\textbf{~}}] \textbf{\uline{Teaching}}
\item [{2022,~2023}] \textbf{Mathematics for Data Science 1} (MATH7501,
University of Queensland; Undergraduate)
\item [{2022,~2023}] \textbf{Problems and Applications in Modern Statistics}
(STAT3500, University of Queensland; Undergraduate)
\item [{2021--2023}] \textbf{Statistical Learning} (STAT3006, University
of Queensland; Undergraduate)
\item [{2020,~2021}] \textbf{Models for bioinformatics} (STA5MB, La Trobe
University; Postgraduate)

\begin{comment}
Also 2018. A masters level course on the application of statistical
models and methods to the analysis of bioinformatics data. This course
covered the use of visualization and exploratory tools for investigating
bioinformatics data, as well as rigorous methods of analysis, such
as via hypothesis testing and false discovery rate control protocols.
The course contained both theoretical and practical aspects of bioinformatics
data analysis, as well as computation, which was taught in the R programming
language.
\end{comment}

\item [{2016}] \textbf{Experimental design} (STAT3003, University of Queensland;
Undergraduate)

\begin{comment}
A series of four lectures was taught on the topic of sampling theory
and finite population statistics.
\end{comment}

\end{lyxlist}
%

La Trobe University; Undergraduate)
